main event: Two separate observers reported a disc-shaped metallic object hovering in the sky for 45 minutes before disappearing, with no further details or analysis provided.
interesting points: The object appeared to be disc-shaped, with a light pink or white color and an estimated size of 30 to 40 feet in diameter.
It emitted a dark, shadowy trail or exhaust and exhibited varying speeds, but no changes in direction or altitude.
Other observers also described the object similarly to the first observer.
The object suddenly accelerated to an extremely high speed and disappeared over the trees to the east.
The witness estimated the object to be about 6 inches in diameter and possibly 20 to 25 miles away before its rapid acceleration.
sighted object: One disc-shaped metallic object with a light pink or white color
photographs: No photographs included in the report
